Anyone going to the #Herozona #NaVOBA business fair tomorrow? Look out for the FireDrum booth. Stop by and say hi! We have a special offer for all attendees! See you there!

FireDrum is an email marketing company based in Scottsdale, AZ. Our core business is creating cost-effective, email marketing solutions that work.  We can handle everything from a do it yourself campaign to corporate, multi-location campaigns with complicated logic.

I help companies find the professionals they need to grow their team. We specifically focus on placing technical, and engineering professionals. We offer a full life cycle recruiting and consulting services for short and long term projects.

Moon Valley Nurseries is the largest box tree grower in the United States. As a seasonal sales associate I informed customers about the different trees and shrubs that grow here in the valley and I provided them with a free landscape design. Customers invest anywhere from  $1,000 - $20,000 depending on the value of the home. I guided my clients through the full process from their first inquiry until after the planting was completed.

Datasphere provides big business advertising for a small business budget.As an account manager I had the freedom to do business development without an assigned list of leads. The company allowed us to call any group we knew we could provide a good value to in our marketing package. I was responsible for calling anywhere between 60-100 companies daily closing anywhere between 1-3 new clients a day.

I managed a small group of high preforming sales reps. This was an inbound sales team that focused on marketing high ticket items that ranged from $2,000-$6,000. As a Sales manager my duties included:- creating sales reports- distributing and generating new leads- filing financing paperwork with our lender for our customers- recruiting and training new sales reps- listening to recorded calls for quality assurance and ongoing training- closing leads when it was necessary- provided customer service to customers after the sale if for some reason the customers situation had escalated outside the realm of our customer service department.- I fine tuned the existing Salesforce account to fit the entire sales cycle for easy reporting, and lead distribution.- I would write compelling marketing content that would be used in emails and on our websites.- I worked with our offshore graphic design team to improve the visual marketing content. - I would oversee the installation department aiding them in recruiting and training our team of outside sales reps, and also the contractors that would install our line of walk-in tubs in the homes of our clients.- I worked on a salary and was highly available during nights, weekends, and holidays. I've even closed deals on Christmas Day. Some of my highlights include:- closing 7 new customers while taking all the phone calls on Memorial Day 2015. - Pulling off the freeway to close a sale in the parking lot of a gas station, the sale was a $5,000 item.- Closing entire bathroom remodel packages over the phone without having ever met the client in person, or seeing their bathroom. I was able to build enough trust and rapport that they paid a deposit and allowed us to move forward.
I studied Video Production Technology. Specifically live studio operation from camera operator to floor director. I studied AVID editing software, as well as Final Cut Studios.

I was able to intern at City of Glendale's office of tourism during the year that the super bowl was coming to AZ for the first time. This was a high school internship where I was discovering my strengths and interests and deciding on a career path. My duties included data entry, assisting tourists by giving suggestions on places to go and see during their visit. I worked under Lorraine Pino who coordinates the many activities in Downtown Glendale including the Chocolate Affair.
